input_text:
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: Washington, DC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Salary Range: $60,000.00 To $88,165 Annually

USAC’s target compensation range for a new hire into this position is $60,000 - $88,165 USD per year. Actual salary may vary depending on job-related factors based on knowledge, skills, and experience, as evaluated throughout the interview process. In addition, this position may be eligible for an annual performance bonus. USAC has a comprehensive benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Commuter Benefits and Wellness Programs.

Why Work Here?

Our mission to achieve universal service addresses America’s current critical needs to build out broadband capabilities for telehealth, online learning, and keeping families connected. Join us and help USAC accomplish our mission to bridge the digital divide. Through its administration of the $10 billion Universal Service Fund (USF) programs on behalf of the FCC, USAC works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. Additional information on USF programs can be found at: https://www.usac.org/about/

Benefits

USAC supports our employees well beyond their salary with a system of benefits that rivals the top organizations in the country. Simply put: if you are committed to improving the lives of others, we are committed to improving yours. USAC provides low-premium, top-of-the-line medical, dental, and vision insurance in addition to disability and life coverage. Generous 401k contribution, Federal and floating holidays, paid sick leave and vacation time that increases every year. Regular telework schedule and opportunities to take professional development courses and training.

 A Multicultural Team

We have actively built an organization that doesn’t just celebrate our diversity; we depend on it. The challenges of achieving universal service require creative and unique perspectives. Our accepting and inclusive community will challenge you to grow and learn from others while always recognizing the value of your contribution.

To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume, click the “Apply For This Job Online” button.

USAC employees are passionate about our mission. Our work contributes to the success of all Americans. We’ve worked together to build a culture that is collaborative, ambitious, outcome-oriented, and feedback-focused. As USAC continues to support universal service impacting healthcare providers, educators, and consumers, it is critical now more than ever that we hire people equally passionate and committed to helping fulfill our mission. We are currently seeking a dynamic and collaborative professional to serve as a Staff Accountant.

This is an outstanding career opportunity for an individual interested in a genuine professional challenge in support of a public-spirited mission.

Working in a creative and fast-paced environment, the Staff Accountant supports the Universal Service Fund (USF) accounting function at USAC by preparing periodic financial statements, analyzing accounts, and providing management with financial research.

Responsibilities

Applying principles of accounting (GAAP) to everyday activities.Preparing weekly, monthly, and yearly reconciliations and reportsAssisting Manager and Senior Accountants with analysis of transactionsPerforming monthly General Ledger to sub-ledger reconciliation, researching and correcting identified issuesPreparing reports on financial results for use by Management and other usersRecording data using Microsoft Excel through data linking and use of pivot tablesAssisting Manager and Senior Accountants with daily, monthly, and yearly workflow and special projectsPreparing monthly, quarterly and annual reports for external and internal useCommunicating issues and procedures to colleagues and external parties in an effective mannerLiaising with IT team to help develop and test basic updates to accounting systemsWorking with program managers to identify and correct anomalies in specific accounts Other projects as assigned


About You

The successful candidate will excel at operating in a diverse and fluid environment and will be crucial for the success of the Finance division.

Bachelor’s Degree and/or relevant technical training and certifications.Training or Formal Education Fields in Accounting, Finance and/or Business.Three (3) to Four (4) years of directly related experience.Proficiency in GAAPExperience with the following: GL Accounting systems, Accounts Payable and Receivable and Fixed Assets.Experience preparing and/or reconciling the accounting records of a financial reporting entity.Ability to handle a large variety of details and work with all levels of the organization.Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to manage multiple priorities and work with a sense of urgency to meet tight deadlines.Ability to translate complex analytical findings into comprehensive insights for business stakeholder.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.Other Desired Experience: Telecommunications Industry; Regulatory


USAC is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace for all employees. All offers of employment with USAC are conditioned on completing and passing a background and reference check. USAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No agencies please.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
